list_definition.definition: to make into or become ice

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: It’s so cold that the river has frozen over.

list_definition.mean_english: lạnh đến mức nước đóng băng; cực kỳ lạnh
list_definition.definition: (of weather) to be at or below freezing-point

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: If it freezes again tonight, all my plants will die.

list_definition.mean_english: chết vì lạnh; cảm thấy rất lạnh
list_definition.definition: to make or be very cold

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: If you had stayed out all night in the snow, you might have frozen to death (= died of exposure to cold).

list_definition.definition: to make (food) very cold in order to preserve it

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: You can freeze the rest of that food and eat it later.

list_definition.definition: to make or become stiff, still or unable to move (with fear etc)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She froze when she heard the strange noise.

list_definition.definition: to fix prices, wages etc at a certain level

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: If the economic situation does not improve, wages will be frozen again.

list_definition.definition: a period of very cold weather when temperatures are below freezing-point

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: How long do you think the freeze will last?

list_ex_of_english: We therefore believe that freezing testicular tissues is an efficient method of cytopreservation of spermatogenic cells.
Perhaps manufacturers became progressively frozen out of land-based polite society.
After freezing, the finer-grained soils also had greater pore-ice content in comparison.
